intro: Sporoxeia blastifolia, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are pollinated by insects. Sporoxeia blastifolia is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
